title: Remember oligodendrocytes: Uncovering their overlooked role in Alzheimer’s disease
content:
by Lena Spieth, Mikael Simons

Our understanding of Alzheimer’s disease (AD) has evolved from focusing solely on neurons to recognizing the role of glia. A recent study in PLOS Biology revealed that oligodendrocytes are an important source of Aβ that impairs neuronal function.
